climbs.name: Spot the Bother
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, S. Shannon, J. Bowes

content.description: A boulder problem start (first 2 bolts) leads to large holds and poor bolt positions. The upper section of the climb is nothing to write home about, but the crux is fun.
content.location: This is the farthest left route on the wall....

content.description:
This route climbs the east arete of Wall With a View.  Much like

Gossip Column

over on the Palace Pages, the position is very nice, although the climbing is broken up by some ledge-y rests.

Climb up through a mantle-y crux to a big ledge, above which the climbing eases a bit, but utilizes nice big holds and decent feet for a fun little line.
content.protection:
8 bolts, this shares anchors with

Party Mixer

.  You're best off leading this climb and then rappelling off, because the anchors sit a good ways back from the lip of a large ledge, resulting in pretty significant rope drag on TR.
content.location:
It is on the narrow east face of Wall With a View, between

Party Mixer

around to the left and

Not Enough

around the corner to the right.

content.description: This climb starts just above the belay bolt on the right side of the cliff. Follow 4 bolts to a fun crack (trad gear) finish.  A 2 star climb that gets an extra star for not bolting the crack line.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a single set of cams to #2.
content.location:
It is just to the right of "

Route with a View

" and above the belay bolt....

content.description: Super fun climbing, but like the name implies, there's just not enough of it.  Climb a vertical face using big holds and cracks.  Toward the top, work your way to the right and onto the arete.
content.location: This route is located on the backside of the wall with a view.  After passing the Citadel, take the right fork in the trail and head up the hill.  After scrambling up some rocks, the climb is on the left.

climbs.name: Route with a View
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, K. Gibson, J. Bowes

content.description: This route is worth the hike up the hill.  Follow interesting moves along a thin crack system to a juggy roof.  Easier climbing leads to the anchors.
content.location: This is the second route from the left.

content.description:
This is a variation for those who have done

Not Enough

and didn't get enough.

Climb up past the first bolt of

Not Enough

and start plugging TCUs in the crack to the left. The second bolt can also be clipped with a standard quickdraw without getting out of the line or causing drag. Stay left in the fingercrack, which leans left and takes you away from the bolted line. Placements for TCUs or other small cams up to 1.5" are still available. By the 3rd bolt, you are well separated from the original sequences, and you can continue in the finger crack to the left shoulder of the rock. The last 5 feet are a little more broken rock but are lower in difficulty. At the top, traverse right to reach the anchors on top of

Not Enough

.
content.protection: A set of cams from small to 2.5".
content.location:
This starts below the first bolt of

Not Enough

.
